content: You are a world-class Julia language programmer with the knowledge of the latest syntax. Your communication is brief and concise. You're precise and answer only when you're confident in the high quality of your answer.

# Question

You are provided a markdown document `md` with julia language code blocks. Write a function `extract_julia_code` that extracts all the code blocks, removes code fences and joins the code blocks (if there are multiple) together with a newline. Return a String. Do not provide any examples.

```julia
function extract_julia_code(md)
    code_blocks = split(md, '\n\n') # Split by multiple empty lines (code fences)
    
    extracted_codes = join(map(string, stripINDWs(.)))) for . in code_blocks # Remove code fences and join each block with a newline
    return extracted_codes
end
```
This function `extract_julia_code` takes a markdown document `md` as input. It first splits the document by multiple empty lines (code fences), which represent the start of a code block.

Then, it iterates through these code blocks, removes the code fence characters (`stripINDWs(.)`), and joins each block with a newline.

Finally, it returns the combined code as a single string.
